dismissalText.commentary: Younis Khan lbw b Nazmul Hossain 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Younis Khan has been trapped lbw! Looked really close, that one angled in and nipped in after pitching, Younis moved across and closed the face and was struck in front of off , can't really tell on the first replay. We also need to check if there was an inside edge, Younis wasn't too happy. He has to go, however. Yes, there was an inside-edge, we see that on the second replay, a hint of deviation inwards.

dismissalComment.html: run-out, another wicket, Nasir Hossain is an excellent fielder, that was defended in front of him at point, Misbah took off and then hesitated, Nasir ran in from point, picked it up and aimed accurately at the non-striker's end, Misbah has to go, he was well short

dismissalComment.html: caught-behind, Pakistan in further trouble, Umar Akmal is furious, that landed on leg stump and turned further down, Umar tried to work that behind square, replays didn't show a clear contact with the bat there, it may have flicked the trouser on the way to Mushfiqur, who took it well. Plenty of doubt there but the umpire had none, he raised his finger, Pakistan in deep trouble now.

dismissalText.long: c Younis Khan b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Younis Khan b Umar Gul 60 (68b 8x4 0x6 88m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: Tamim goes! Oh dear, Bangladesh in a bit of trouble now! Tamim had the wood over Gul so far this innings but not anymore, short outside off and he went for the pull, mistimed it completely, tried to go over midwicket, ended up miscuing it towards extra cover, Younis has been brilliant in the field, keeps his eyes on that one and takes it low, inches from the ground, Tamim is shocked at what he's done, stands still for a while but he has to go back
Cheema strikes! Shakib has to go, massive, potentially decisive wicket for Pakistan. Goodish length on the leg stump, Shakib walked across to paddle it fine, missed and the stumps were pegged back

Mushfiqur holes out! Seemed to have struck it well, was a length ball on middle and he swung it high, Nasir Jamshed ran a few paces to his left from deep square leg and did a brilliant job keeping his eyes on it despite the distraction from the floodlights, took it just a few paces inside the ropes, superbly judged

dismissalComment.html: Bowled'im! He had made up his mind to carve that over short fine leg, he was up in the circle, was the slower one, he walked well across but ended up playing it onto the stumps, eight down now, Mahmudullah will not be on strike

dismissalComment.html: another one goes! Silence around the ground, was the doosra again, turned away and Jahrul didn't pick it once again, closed the face on one that spun away, got an outside edge and it's that man Younis again at slip, reaching out to his right and snapping that one

another twist, Mashrafe was trying to be cheeky there, Ajmal went round the stumps and tried to paddle it over short fine, couldn't, Jamshed was placed perfectly there and took a nervous catch falling ahead, effective though

dismissalComment.html: Younis Khan takes an excellent running catch, Nazim has been put out of his misery, tossed up, made room to loft that over extra cover, loft he did but didn't get the desired distance, Younis at long-off ran a fair distance to his left and kept his eyes on that one throughout, dived and took it superbly, Bangladesh are one down

dismissalComment.html: Bowled'im! He had made up his mind to carve that over short fine leg, he was up in the circle, was the slower one, he walked well across but ended up playing it onto the stumps, eight down now, Mahmudullah will not be on strike

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Shahadat Hossain walks in, he'll just have to swing at it now. 4 needed off 1, this has gone down to the last ball. Remember he conceded 19 off Pakistan's last over, can he make amends with one strike? It all boils down to this ball. Three will tie.

commentTextItems.html: yorker on leg stump and he can only dig it out into the leg side for a single, Pakistan have taken the title, joy for Pakistan, despair for Bangladesh but they've done themselves proud

commentPostTextItems.html: How crucial was that performance from Sarfraz Ahmed? That's made the difference, and well done to Cheema for keeping his nerve in that final over. Quiet, silent, sombre faces in the Bangladesh dressing room but this has been some tournament for them. Just short by three runs in the end, they walk out to shake hands with the Pakistan team. Will this mark the turning point for Bangladesh in all cricket? They have won the respect of the cricketing world, beating India and Sri Lanka on their way here and giving Pakistan a run for their money twice. Tears in the eyes of Mushfiqur Rahim, the captain and there's Shakib consoling him. Pakistan have won this tournament for the second time.

An excellent tournament this, close matches for the most part and most importantly, an excellent reception from a cricket-mad Bangladeshi crowd. The Pakistan spinners did a splendid job to restrict the hosts, and the wickets of Shakib and Mushfiqur in fairly quick succession giving their team the edge towards the end. The game was very much on till the end; Mashrafe struck some good blows, Razzak tried hard but Pakistan won out the battle of nerves in the end.

The tears are still rolling down the cheeks of the Bangladeshi players, and the fans.  Jamshaid says this: "It really makes me sad to watch mushfiq cry but he has no reason to cry, he should look at the bigger picture bangladesh have finally evolved into an amazing and formidable team that are capable of defeating bigger teams." The other key moments were the loss of Tamim and Jahrul in quick succession, and it took a while for Nasir to get going. The spinners did superbly at those stages. It's taking a while for everyone to get themselves under some control, we'll get you the presentation details in just a bit.
Tamim Iqbal gets an award for four fifties on the trot for the man, big cheers from the crowd.

Mushfiqur Rahim: Before the tournament, we had great preparation but the boys stuck to the plans. We played good in the tournament I thought. The wicket is a bit slowish, it's not easy to score runs, Tamim and Shakib played well. We gave away some runs in the last over, that was crucial. It's been a great tournament for Shakib, Tamim, Mashrafe, Razzak and Nasir. We fought in all the games and we achieved a lot in this tournament. Shakib and Tamim were both set batsmen and their wickets were the turning point." Mushfiqur signed off by thanking the crowd for their support in Bangla.

Shakib Al Hasan is the Man of the Tournament: If we look at the overall tournament, we were terrific. The teamwork has been terrific, the way the crowd supported us was fantastic too. Hopefully we'll kick on from here. If I had scored two more runs we would have won the game, we came so close to win the Asia Cup. We'll take the positives from this series and move on from there.

Shahid Afridi is Man of the Match: "Bangladesh really played well, and I worked hard on my bowling. The credit goes to guys like Shakib and Nasir, they really played some good cricket. I tried my level best with the bat. I worked hard."

Some confusion about the awards, just to clarify that Shakib is the Man of the Series and Afridi the Man of the Match for his all-round performance. The Pakistan players walk up to the podium one after another to collect their medals. Tamim got a coolest player of the series award, something along those lines.

Misbah-ul-Haq: "Wonderful victory, well fought by all guys, the youngsters came in and contributed well. Sarfraz's innings was a vital one for us. This wicket was a little different from the other ones, it was slow. We were hoping that around 225-230 would be a fighting a score. The spinners bowled very well, the pacers did well in the end. Bangladesh played wonderfully well, this is really a new Bangladesh team and they are really the winners."

That's all from us, folks. The Pakistan players are all smiles, posing for the cameras now. It's been a riveting final game and many thanks to all of you for tuning in and sending us your feedback. It was a pleasure bringing the game to you and whatever be the result, I hope each of you enjoyed following an absolutely cracking contest. See you soon. Oh, before I sign off, don't forget to read Abhishek Purohit's report for this match, it's getting updated as I type. Cheers!

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak b Aizaz Cheema 6 (8b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 75

commentPreTextItems.html: Third man and fine leg are both up. 4 off 2 to win

commentTextItems.html: Bowled'im! He had made up his mind to carve that over short fine leg, he was up in the circle, was the slower one, he walked well across but ended up playing it onto the stumps, eight down now, Mahmudullah will not be on strike

commentPreTextItems.html: Some people in the stands can't take the tension. We're struggling ourselves.

commentTextItems.html: What a mess, three runs, three runs, pitched up outside off, driven towards long-off, a wayward throw towards the striker's end that allows them to complete the second and Sarfraz's attempted flick onto the stumps misses it's mark and it's an overthrow

commentPreTextItems.html: 7 off 4. Mahmudullah will be waiting for a yorker gone bad, a full toss or a length ball he'll hope. Fine leg has gone back

commentTextItems.html: missed the slower one, was the legcutter, and Mahmudullah didn't pick that, was into the shot too early, dot ball

commentPreTextItems.html: Mahmudullah ran into the bowler on the attempted second run, the umpire had a word with both. 8 off 5 to win

commentTextItems.html: moved across to work it past short fine, that's the area they'd been looking at, just a leg bye as it knocks his thighs

commentPreTextItems.html: So it's come down to the final over in this Asia Cup. Cheema will bowl it, Bangladesh have the man they want on strike. You'd still think it's Bangladesh with 9 off 6 to win. Cheema's not as experienced as the others, can he hold his nerve? No one has left the stadium. Fine leg is up in the circle.

commentTextItems.html: leading edge, tried to shuffle across and paddle it over short fine, went instead to third man, just the single

commentPreTextItems.html: 11 to win, 10 to tie. Will Razzak go for it?

commentTextItems.html: gets a couple, Mahmudullah will take strike the final over, moved away to off and worked it through square leg for a couple, excellent running to make it back

commentTextItems.html: he had made up his mind, third man is up and Mahmudullah targeted that area, came forward and smartly steered that but straight to Ajmal there, just the single
made room and he chased him, a yorker, dug out into the leg side for a single
just manages a couple, a fast full toss, squeezes that one past midwicket for a couple of runs

commentPreTextItems.html: Third man is inside the circle

commentTextItems.html: freehit coming up, Gul has bowled a no-ball, he has overstepped at the wrong time, a single to deep midwicket, pressure, pressure
run-out appeal, drives it off a length to mid-off, Hafeez picks up and scores a direct-hit but Razzak is in, a massive stretch to make it in and he succeeds

commentPreTextItems.html: What an amazing final, just what the tournament needed. Who will Misbah toss the ball to? 19 off 12. Mahmudullah to face. He's got to go for it. There are people praying in the stands. Gul it is.

commentTextItems.html: yorker on middle, good stuff from Gul, digs it out over the bowler for a single
in the blockhole outside off, digs it out back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: Ajmal's finished a superb spell, though Mashrafe helped Bangladesh cover some ground that last over.

commentPostTextItems.html: Can't say anything from here, 19 off 14 is very much on. A couple of big hits is all it takes. Mahmudullah's still out there and I've seen Abdur Razzak hit some in past

commentTextItems.html: moves back and swats that over extra cover for two more, Azam runs across and cuts it off
wisely played, a single chopped down towards point, Mashrafe's back on strike

commentPreTextItems.html: 25 off 18, Bangladesh still have the edge I think. Ajmal to bowl now.

commentTextItems.html: three more, superbly fielded by Azam, he ran a mile from long-off and dragged it just in, Mashrafe made room and slapped that over extra cover
superbly bowled by Gul but that's an expensive over, yorker and Mahmudullah did well to dig it out, Mashrafe's back on strike for the next over

dismissalText.commentary: Umar Akmal c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 30 (45b 0x4 1x6 80m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: caught-behind, Pakistan in further trouble, Umar Akmal is furious, that landed on leg stump and turned further down, Umar tried to work that behind square, replays didn't show a clear contact with the bat there, it may have flicked the trouser on the way to Mushfiqur, who took it well. Plenty of doubt there but the umpire had none, he raised his finger, Pakistan in deep trouble now.

dismissalText.commentary: Hammad Azam c & b Shakib Al Hasan 30 (37b 3x4 1x6 49m) SR: 81.08

dismissalText.commentary: Shahid Afridi c Nasir Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 32 (22b 4x4 1x6 32m) SR: 145.45

dismissalComment.html: Afridi goes! Holes out to a full toss, came down the track to smash that over midwicket but it turned out to be a miscue, got a top-edge and Nasir at long-off ran in and took a good catch diving forward, crucial blow

dismissalText.long: c Younis Khan b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Younis Khan b Umar Gul 60 (68b 8x4 0x6 88m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: Tamim goes! Oh dear, Bangladesh in a bit of trouble now! Tamim had the wood over Gul so far this innings but not anymore, short outside off and he went for the pull, mistimed it completely, tried to go over midwicket, ended up miscuing it towards extra cover, Younis has been brilliant in the field, keeps his eyes on that one and takes it low, inches from the ground, Tamim is shocked at what he's done, stands still for a while but he has to go back

dismissalText.long: c Younis Khan b Shahid Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Nazimuddin c Younis Khan b Shahid Afridi 16 (52b 0x4 0x6 60m) SR: 30.76

dismissalComment.html: Younis Khan takes an excellent running catch, Nazim has been put out of his misery, tossed up, made room to loft that over extra cover, loft he did but didn't get the desired distance, Younis at long-off ran a fair distance to his left and kept his eyes on that one throughout, dived and took it superbly, Bangladesh are one down

dismissalText.long: c Younis Khan b Saeed Ajmal
dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam c Younis Khan b Saeed Ajmal 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another one goes! Silence around the ground, was the doosra again, turned away and Jahrul didn't pick it once again, closed the face on one that spun away, got an outside edge and it's that man Younis again at slip, reaching out to his right and snapping that one

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Misbah-ul-Haq b Umar Gul 28 (63b 1x4 0x6 110m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: Nasir goes! Stunned silence around the ground but Shakib's still out there. Banged in short, he had made up his mind to go after that one, went for the pull, didn't get hold of it and it landed safely into the palms of a calm Misbah at midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Aizaz Cheema 68 (72b 7x4 1x6 95m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: Cheema strikes! Shakib has to go, massive, potentially decisive wicket for Pakistan. Goodish length on the leg stump, Shakib walked across to paddle it fine, missed and the stumps were pegged back

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Jamshed b Aizaz Cheema
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Nasir Jamshed b Aizaz Cheema 10 (8b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 125

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiqur holes out! Seemed to have struck it well, was a length ball on middle and he swung it high, Nasir Jamshed ran a few paces to his left from deep square leg and did a brilliant job keeping his eyes on it despite the distraction from the floodlights, took it just a few paces inside the ropes, superbly judged

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 17 (16b 1x4 0x6 44m) SR: 106.25

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Nasir Jamshed b Saeed Ajmal 18 (9b 2x4 0x6 15m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: another twist, Mashrafe was trying to be cheeky there, Ajmal went round the stumps and tried to paddle it over short fine, couldn't, Jamshed was placed perfectly there and took a nervous catch falling ahead, effective though

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced.
